column2: rampant consumerism and environmental neglect have turned Earth into a garbage-strewn wasteland. Humanity is nowhere to be found
column3: having been evacuated by the megacorporation Buy-N-Large (BnL) on giant starliners seven centuries earlier. Of all the robotic trash compactors left by BnL to clean up
column4: only one remains operational: a Waste Allocation Load-Lifter: Earth Class
column6: WALL-E's routine is broken by the arrival of an unmanned probe carrying an Extraterrestrial Vegetation Evaluator or EVE
column7: sent to scan the planet for plant life. WALL-E is smitten by the sleek
column9: but she goes into standby when he shows her his most recent find: a living seedling. The probe returns to collect EVE and the plant
column12: the starliner Axiom. In the centuries since the Axiom left Earth
column13: its passengers have degenerated into helpless corpulence due to laziness and microgravity
column14: their every whim catered to by machines. Captain McCrea
column15: used to sitting back while his robotic lieutenant AUTO flies the ship
column16: is taken aback by a positive probe response and learns that placing the plant in the ship's Holo-Detector will trigger a hyperjump back to Earth so humanity can begin recolonization. The plant proves to be missing from EVE's storage compartment though
column17: and she blames WALL-E for its disappearance. With the plant missing
column18: EVE is deemed faulty and taken to Diagnostics. WALL-E proceeds to """free""" her along with the other faulty robots
column19: causing them to be designated rogue. Frustrated
column20: EVE tries to send WALL-E home on an escape pod
column21: but they are interrupted when AUTO's first mate GO-4 arrives and stows the stolen plant in a pod set to self-destruct. WALL-E saves the plant from being lost for good
column23: celebrating with a dance in space around the Axiom. EVE brings the plant back to McCrea
column24: who watches EVE's recordings of Earth and concludes that they have to go back. However
column26: revealing his own secret no-return directive A113
column27: issued after BnL inaccurately concluded centuries ago that the planet could not be saved. When McCrea countermands this directive
column29: electrocuting WALL-E and shutting EVE down
column30: and throwing them both down the garbage chute. EVE and WALL-E are nearly ejected to space along with the ship's trash
column31: but are saved by """Microbe" "Obliterator""" or M-O
column32: who followed WALL-E's dirt trail to clean him. McCrea struggles with AUTO while EVE
column34: and M-O bring the plant to the ship's Holo-Detector. The humans and defective robots help them in securing the plant. AUTO crushes WALL-E in the Holo-Detector
column37: initiating a hyperjump. Arriving back on Earth
column39: but finds that his memory has been reset and his personality is gone. Heartbroken
column40: EVE gives WALL-E a farewell kiss
column41: which sparks his memory and restores his original personality. WALL-E and EVE reunite as the humans and robots of the Axiom take their first steps on Earth. During the credits
column42: humans and robots are shown learning to farm
column45: turning the ravaged planet into a paradise
column46: and the plant is shown to have grown into a mighty tree.
